column2: Role & responsibilities  : 1)	Responsible for leading a team of network engineers and technicians. This includes hiring, training, and performance management of the team members. 2)	Oversee the monitoring of the WiFi network to identify any performance issues, network outages, or security breaches.  3)	Coordinate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve these issues promptly. 4)	Take charge of incident management processes, ensuring that all incidents are logged, tracked, and resolved within the agreed-upon service level agreements (SLAs).  5)	Work closely with their team to escalate critical incidents and coordinate with other teams or vendors, if necessary, to achieve timely resolution. 6)	Responsible for evaluating the WiFi network's capacity and planning for future growth or upgrades based on usage patterns and business requirements.  7)	Work with the team to ensure that sufficient network resources are available to meet demand. 8)	Oversee efforts to optimize the WiFi network's performance, ensuring that it meets defined performance metrics and provides a seamless user experience.  9)	Analyse network data, identify bottlenecks, and implement appropriate solutions or improvements. 10)	Ensure that accurate documentation is maintained for the WiFi network infrastructure, including network diagrams, configurations, and standard operating procedures.  11)	Prepare regular reports on network performance, incidents, and key performance indicators (KPIs) for management and stakeholders. 12)	Interact with WiFi equipment vendors and service providers to ensure effective communication, manage service-level agreements, and coordinate support and maintenance activities. 13)	Responsible for implementing and maintaining appropriate security measures for the WiFi network. 14)	Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and best practices related to network security. 15)	Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the NOC, seeking opportunities to enhance operational efficiency, network reliability, and customer satisfaction.  16)	Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends. 17)	Collaborates with other teams, such as network engineering, system administrators, and customer support, to ensure effective communication and coordination.  18)	Participate in cross-functional meetings and provide technical expertise and guidance. Preferred candidate profile  : 1) 9 plus years of experience over working on large complex Enterprise class Networks or B.Sc (Computers) with 10 plus years of working experience on large complex enterprise network- Mandatory 2) Must have handson experience in Routing protocols like MPLS (traffic engineering, L2/L3 VPN), BGP-4/MP-BGP, ISIS, OSPF/OSPFv3, EIGRP, RSVP, RSVP, LDP, VXLAN, Network Access Control, 802.1x, VPN. - Mandatory. 3) Experience on SD-WAN - Mandatory 4) Experience in Software Defined Network (SDN) - Mandatory 5) At least 3-5 years of experience in leading a NOC of L1/L2/L3 Engineers. - Mandatory 6) Extensive experience leading and managing complex internetworking solutions from design to implementation. - Mandatory 7) Experience of multi-vendor / multi-service IP networks, multi-vendor equipment and network protocols. - Mandatory 8) Experience in Video Conferencing Equipment Management and Operations. - Desirable. 9) Experience in Fiber deployment including its active components - Desirable 10) Experience in Security devices - Added advantage.  11) Experience in dealing with banks / financial institutions /NBFCs - Added advantage Certifications : 1) CCNP - Mandatory 2) CCIE - Desirable 2) ITIL Foundation / ITIL Managing Professional (MP) - Desirable Knowledge : 1) In-depth knowledge in  Software Defined Networks (SDN) & SD-WAN - Mandatory 2) Expert knowledge in Networking, data communications, information security and systems Engineering. - Mandatory 3) Knowledge in Technical Bid evaluation and processing - Mandatory 4) Knowledge on Network devices of various OEMs such as; Cisco, Juniper, Alcatel..etc - Mandatory 5) Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills - Mandatory 6) MS Office & MS Visio- Mandatory 7) Knowledge in VC Managements and its protocols - Desireable 8) Knowledge on Fiber and its active components such as MUX, Transponders, LIU, OTDR..etc - Desireable 9) Knowledge on Project Management - Added advantage
column11: Wireless, Sdwan, Networking, SDN, WiFi

May conduct briefings with senior leaders within the job function.      May at times be required to negotiate regarding operational issues. column2: Role & responsibilities   MID  ( Associate Engineer Network 6 Lpa )   Excellent background gained in a telecoms Strong experience & knowledge SDH/Ethernet/Fiber/Microwave network Planning Proven success in delivery of technical projects. Practical experience / understanding of an operational network environment, ability to understand and foresee risks, problems & issues from a technical and operational perspective. Good knowledge of Cramer, Apollo, Circuit Manager, Nemesis, IQ Link, NRM, Map Info, Google Earth, Grid Finder etc. Vendor Transmission equipment (MW  Nokia, Nec, Siae + Ericsson) Vendor Base Station equipment (Huawei, Nokia + Ericsson) OLO Vendor equipment (BT and VM) B.Tech in Electronics and Communication  NOC  ( Service Reliability Engineer 6 Lpa)   Building a wide understanding of the evergrowing Mobile RAN network and the components and technology involved in 2, 3, 4 and 5G base stations, power supplies, antennae, microwave links, DAS (Distrubuted Antennae Systems) and Repeaters. This includes both at ground level cabin / base stations as well as at height antennas.  Managing and Controlling our field engineering resource  IXD, Climbing and Radio & Rigging engineers.This will involve working very closely with Engineering Services (ES) and organising their diaries based on the customer SLA, geographical location and skill of task. Planning and arranging engineer access permits to the approx. 16,000 Telefonica mobile customer premise sites across the countrythat contain mobile mast and provide signal to their cuistomers. This includes, schools, farms, shops, offices and many many more!  Extensive planning and organisation of Radio & Rigging activities and the complexities of this which includes their certification to climb at height, health and safety in the risks associated as well as the logistical organisation of cherry pickers, MEWPs, 4X4 and/or ATV (all-terrain vechicle).  Building Risk Assessment & Method Statements, sometimes site specific, and liasing with Health & Safety representatives, addressing an engineers on-site risks and mitigations to these riks.  Jeapardy managing high profile and service affecting incidents on Telefonicas mobile network. Reacting to high-service affecting faults, ensuring that customer restoration is at the forefront of all decisions.  Taking incoming calls from Engineers and managing the progression of engineering tasks i.e. if further work is required due to a delay in access, spare, proven to height and handling this update. Handling high-level escalations and managing customer expectations accordingly.  Building and establishing good working relationships with our Field Engineering partners, vendors & communicating to stakeholders & customer in real-time to restore service. Monitor and manage performance against team and network Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Service Level Agreement?? ( SLA??) targets relating to all provision or incidents. Responsible for ensuring all quality detailed notes and updates are documented on the agreed system to reduce risk to service. Progress personal learning and development and career planning. Perks and benefits   Both side cabs +incetives + Night shift allowances  If interested call or whatsApp HR Sanjana @ 9999129207 Reference highly appreciated

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and driven Packet Core Engineer to join our Ericsson team     In this essential role, youll have the unique opportunity to perform analysis, audit, design and optimization across diverse telecom networks     Were looking for individuals prepared to delve into areas of RAN, Transport, Core, OM, and Services Networks; individuals who can pivot from pre-sales engagement to service delivery with ease and excellence     As a Packet Core Engineer at Ericsson, you will leverage deep technical understanding to produce high-quality network designs, audits, and optimization services tailored to both Ericsson requirements and customer needs     Your role is crucial in driving technology innovation, identifying new solutions and propelling services that ensure the financial, commercial, environment, health, and safety performance of our NDO services               What you will do:               Take care of Packet Core deliveries for the region based out at Kolkata location     Take care for one MSC location in Kolkata     1st level analysis from packet core part     Day to day working on circle packet core deliveries     Customer facing at times if needed     Physical support for MSC location                  The skills you bring:               4 to 8 years of validated experience       Solid understanding of Telecom Networks specially in 2G/3G/4G/IMS CORE domain     Experience on Packet CORE nodes SGSN/GGSN/DNS/PCRF     Proficient Knowledge of GSM/WCDMA/LTE/VoLTE     Candidates with understanding and Hands on in Ericsson Packet Core products - EPG, MME, WMG, DNS, CUPS, PCC, PCG will be preferred     Understanding of Packet Core protocols and procedures and basic understanding of 5G will be preferred.      Candidate should be ready to move to Kolkata and should be flexible for working hours      Should have a very good interpersonal working skills and good on both verbal and non-verbal communication

Technical/Business Expertise Demonstrated proficiency in the administration of wireless networks, including but not limited to Extreme Wing, Meraki, and Cisco 9800. Proven expertise in administrating Cisco ISE. Extensive experience in strategically planning wireless deployments for both existing and new locations. Proficient in the installation, configuration, and upgrading of wireless infrastructures. Skilled in troubleshooting wireless networks and implementing preventative maintenance measures. Successful track record of leading large-scale projects from initiation to completion. Familiarity with automation tools, including the utilization of API calls for Meraki dashboard and Cisco DNA-C. Possesses resourcefulness and a strong problem-solving aptitude. Experience and Education  3 to 5 years of experience  A degree in MIS, Computer Science, or equivalent technical field from an accredited university or equivalent work experience is required. Core Competencies  Partnerships  Growth mindset  Results oriented  Customer focused  Professionalism
